intro: Sapria himalayana, commonly known as the Himalayan sapria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, evergreen shrub native to the temperate regions of the Himalayas. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale green. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
